Description: Limestone ostracon, very decomposed, with remains of seven and eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink on one side and a further seven lines on the other.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.46, pl.36)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.113-114)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (65427) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/65427)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 36:3 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 174 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
